newsitem.title: YEMEN: Yemen oilfield inauguration set for October 14.
newsitem.headline: Yemen oilfield inauguration set for October 14.

text.p: Yemen's Jannah oilfield will be brought on stream on October 14, an official at the country's oil ministry said on Wednesday.
"Production capacity of the field will be 15,000 barrels per day (bpd) in the first stage and will become 25,000 bpd by the start of March," the official told Reuters.
The field, 485 kms (303 miles) south of the Yemeni capital Sanna in block five, will be operated by U.S. Hunt.
Production from Jannah will be linked to the Hunt-Exxon Corp operated Marib pipeline system which supplies crude to the Ras Isa export terminal on the Red Sea.
Yemen in one of the poorest countries in the Arab world and is dependent on its oilfields which produce some 350,000 bpd.
Marib output currently runs at 170,000 bpd.
The field's inauguration has been timed to coincide with the anniversary of the country's 1963 revolution.
